citation.article-title: Methylothermus thermalis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel moderately thermophilic obligate methanotroph from a hot spring in Japan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methylothermus (Me.thy′lo.ther′mus. N.L. n. methyl the methyl group; N.L. masc. subst. from Gr. adj. thermos hot; Methylothermus methyl-using thermotolerant organism).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile coccoids, of 0·6–0·8 μm in diameter.
Exospores, Azotobacter-type cysts or lipid cysts are not formed.
Possess pMMO and type I ICM as stacks of membrane vesicles.
Obligate methanotrophs utilizing methane or methanol via the RuMP pathway.
Tricarboxylic acid cycle is deficient in α-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase.
Major PLFAs are C16 : 0 and C18 : 1ω9c.
Major phospholipids are phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol.
Phylogenetically belong to the class ‘Gammaproteobacteria’ (type I methanotrophs).
The type species is Methylothermus thermalis.
